comment: WORST PROFESSOR I'VE EVER HAD!!! She made the class impossible for me to be successful in, I had to drop because she refused to assign me to another group when my group members weren't responding to me and she tried to make me work alone and blame me for it. DO NOT TAKE HER - HORRIBLE TEACHER!!!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Group projects--Graded by few things

comment:
There were 3 quizzes and about 6 total assignments. We also had to present our professional identity 3 separate times in front of the class for a grade. 
For a course where she mostly just reads from online lectures in class, the attendance policy should've been more lenient. She provided some learning resources but I wish there were more of them.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Accessible outside class--Online Savvy

comment: Lenient grader with well written criteria so you know exactly what is expected to get a good grade. Grade based on a few major assignments but they were nothing too difficult. The due dates for all the assignments are on the home page of the D2L page which is very helpful. The biggest assignments are group assignments at the end of the semester.
rating_tags: Group projects--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Grade is dependent on a few major projects and a couple of minor assignments, all which build on one another but are easy to complete. Gives great feedback on assignments so you know exactly what to turn in to get the best grade possible, lenient with deadlines, only a couple of days where attendance was mandatory. great teach loved her.
rating_tags: Group projects--Gives good feedback--Graded by few things

comment: I took technical writing as summer class, so it was more fast-paced and it felt like there was a lot of assigned work every week. She provided a helpful online textbook. She included her grading criteria for most of the work, so if you follow the criteria then you should get a good grade. Her feedback was constructive too.
rating_tags: Group projects--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: There were a lot of assignments/projects that we had to do throughout the semester, but luckily, she didn't grade too harshly. Attendance wasn't mandatory most of the time, so she provided plenty of online learning materials. She responds to emails quickly and is very lenient/understanding when it comes to late work.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: The course is all projects. Smaller projects are: Illustrator, Photoshop, Prototyping tools. There is a course long group project (redesigning a government website) that is a significant portion of the grade. Projects can be submitted early for feedback which is helpful considering vague instructions. Grades were not put in until the class ended.
rating_tags: Group projects

comment: She changed the class content for a group project with four phases. It's an easy class with a fast pace; stay on top of your work. You can turn in assignments before the deadline to receive feedback and make changes. She can be a harsh grader but READ the instructions. Ask questions if the guidelines are unclear.
rating_tags: Group projects--Gives good feedback--Graded by few things

comment: She is nice and leniant with deadlines if you let her know your situation (I got a handful of extensions when I told her about my computer issues). The first half of the semester is easy, but the second half is hard because of the textbook. She is available for help, but expect to teach yourself or use Youtube for the adobe portion of the course.
rating_tags: Caring--Accessible outside class

comment: Attendance is optional other than for the final. This class was mostly following the textbook and reading instructions for activities. Professor Shirke was understanding when I submitted an assignment incorrectly and did not count off for a late submission. This class has been a breeze the whole semester! Would highly recommend Professor Shirke!
rating_tags: Accessible outside class

comment: Don't listen to negative reviews! Professor Shirke is great! There is homework, but it isn't difficult as long as you follow instructions and aren't lazy. Not a lot of lectures, but she is always willing to offer advice and expertise if you ask for it. She is flexible and very willing to work with students. She is knowledgeable in her field!
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Caring

comment: She seemed like a nice lady but did not have a whole lot of experience. Additional sources will help you pass. A plus is that she is willing to work with students to help met deadlines. Project heavy class.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class

comment: Vague Explanations on assignments and a tough grader. Received an 88.5% B after maintaining an A the whole semester... Personally id recommend taking a different professor if you can. if not chose your groups wisely being most of the work is group projects. Missed Deans List bc of this class! smh
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Group projects--Tough grader

comment: She can be a tough grader and often times doesn't provide clear feedback. The instructions for the assignments are also a little vague at times. Despite these issues, it's more than possible to pass this class with an A. She still does a decent job at explaining the material and is happy to answer your questions.
rating_tags: Group projects--Tough grader

comment: Ehh. Easy enough class, just do the assignments and follow her criteria and youll do well. A few minor issues: she can give vague or contradictory advice so take a few notes during class to stay on top of it. Also can be condescending and hard to talk to, better to send an email after class than to ask in class if you dont like being called out.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects

comment: This professor is honestly the worst. Terrible at communicating and when you reach out to her for help, she is still gives you a hard time. She is very unorganized and a lot of her instructions for certain assignments aren't clear. For this to be a class about clear communication, she isn't very good at it herself.

Really bad at communicating and not very organized. She just tells you to follow what is on the calendar for assignments. Quizzes use webcam but are easy if read the chapter beforehand. I do not think she even grades assignments/group projects based on the rubric. As long as you have good group members the class will be a easy A.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Group projects

comment: Professor Shirke is a very nice lady outside of the classroom setting. As far as her assignments go, they are extremely tedious, very general. She does take points off for little things. The quizzes are pretty fair. I ended with a B.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Group projects--Accessible outside class

comment: I was skeptical since day one of her class. Shes a very tough grader and will give you a bad grade if you don't do the assignments perfectly. She gives some feedback on assignments, but comments are vague. She takes points off for minor things such as VERY slight formatting problems. Overall, I would not recommend taking her class.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: She could be a little bit more hands on as far as helping us understand assignments. otherwise she is great and a sweet person. she doesn't overload you with busy work, just assignments that are due during the semester and thats it.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria

comment: This professor gives a lot of busy work. You cannot miss more than 3 classes. It is possible to earn an A, but you will have to put a lot of time outside of class in on your projects. Sometimes her instructions are not very clear and she is a little difficult to understand. I made a B with minimal effort. Would take again if I had too.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Great teacher, great class. She seems to love teaching and cares for her students. Not any extremely hard assignments, and there is a lot of time in class to do the projects. Lots of group work, so sit next to smart people. Overall a great teacher and a great class!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring--GROUP PROJECTS
